net.unicon.cas.addons.support

Class ResourceChangeDetectingEventNotifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.unicon.cas.addons.support.ResourceChangeDetectingEventNotifier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.context.ApplicationEventPublisherAware

    public class ResourceChangeDetectingEventNotifier
extends Object
implements org.springframework.context.ApplicationEventPublisherAware
    A class responsible for detecting contents changes of configured resource (file, classpath, URL, etc.) by comparing their SHA1 digests - the one saved at the last check and the latest one. If the change is detected, it publishes Spring's ApplicationEvent typed as ResourceChangedEvent wrapping the resource's URI in question within it.

    Any interested ApplicationListeners within ApplicationContext could then pick up those events and react to them appropriately.

    Note that the periodic polling of the configured resource is not a concern of this class and is configured outside of it. Typically, within Spring ApplicationContext, it is done by TaskScheduler abstraction or the likes.

    This class is thread-safe. It uses proper synchronization to protect resourceSha1Hex field updates from race conditions.

    Since:
    0.7
    Author:
    Dmitriy Kopylenko, Unicon, inc.
